MtkResampleGeom.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00018 #include "MisrToolkit.h"
00019 #include "MisrError.h"
00020 #include <stdio.h>      /* for printf */
00021 #include <getopt.h>     /* for getopt_long */
00022 #include <strings.h>        /* for strncasecmp */
00023 #include <HdfEosDef.h>      /* Definition of GDopen */
00024 
00025 #define MAX_FILENAME 5000
00026 #define MAX_FIELDNAME 1000
00027 #define MAX_LENGTH 1000
00028 #define GP_GMP_GRID_NAME "GeometricParameters"
00029 #define OUTPUT_GRIDNAME "GeometricParameters"
00030 #define NUMBER_FIELD 20
00031 #define NUMBER_CAMERA 9
00032 
00033 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00034 /* Structure to contain command-line arguments.                             */
00035 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00036 
00037 typedef struct {
00038   char *proj_map_file;  /* Projection/map info file */
00039   char *geom_file;      /* AS_LAND file */
00040   char *output_filename; /* Output filename*/
00041 } argr_type;       /* Argument parse result */
00042 
00043 #define ARGR_TYPE_INIT {NULL, NULL, NULL}
00044 
00045 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 /* Local function prototypes                                                */
00047 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00048 
00049 int process_args(int argc, char *argv[], argr_type *argr);
00050 
00051 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00052 /*  Main program.                                                           */
00053 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00054 
00055 int main( int argc, char *argv[] ) {
00056   MTKt_status status;       /* Return status */
00057   MTKt_status status_code = MTK_FAILURE;      /* Return code of this function */
00058   argr_type argr = ARGR_TYPE_INIT;  /* Command-line arguments */
00059   MTKt_GenericMapInfo target_map_info = MTKT_GENERICMAPINFO_INIT;
00060                 /* Target map information. */
00061   MTKt_GCTPProjInfo target_proj_info = MTKT_GCTPPROJINFO_INIT;
00062                 /* Target projection information.  */
00063   MTKt_Region region = MTKT_REGION_INIT; /* SOM region containing target map. */
00064   MTKt_DataBuffer latitude = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00065                 /* Temporary latitude array for reprojection. */
00066   MTKt_DataBuffer longitude = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00067                 /* Temporary longitude array for reprojection. */
00068   MTKt_DataBuffer line_coords = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00069                 /* Temporary line coord array for reprojection. */
00070   MTKt_DataBuffer sample_coords = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00071                 /* Temporary sample coord array for reprojection. */
00072   MTKt_DataBuffer geom_data = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00073                 /* Data for geometric parameters field. */
00074   MTKt_DataBuffer geom_data_float64 = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00075                 /* Data for geometric parameters field. */
00076   MTKt_DataBuffer resampled_geom_data = MTKT_DATABUFFER_INIT; 
00077                 /* Data for geometric parameters field. */
00078   int path;             /* Orbit path number. */
00079   int iline;            /* Loop iterator. */
00080   int isample;          /* Loop iterator. */
00081   int32 fid = FAIL;     /* HDF-EOS file identifier. */
00082   int32 gid = FAIL;     /* HDF-EOS grid identifier. */
00083   int32 hstatus;        /* HDF-EOS status code */
00084   float64 upleft[2];            /* min X, max Y corner of target map. */
00085   float64 lowright[2];          /* max X, min Y corner of target map. */
00086   char *dimlist_ul_lr = "YDim,XDim";
00087                 /* HDF-EOS dimension list for origin UL or 
00088                    origin LR maps.*/
00089   char *dimlist_ur_ll = "XDim,YDim";
00090                 /* HDF-EOS dimension list for origin UR or 
00091                    origin LL maps.*/
00092   char *dimlist;        /* HDF-EOS dimension list. */
00093   int32 edge[2];        /* Size of HDF-EOS data to write. */
00094   char *fieldnames[NUMBER_FIELD] = {"SolarAzimuth",
00095                     "SolarZenith",
00096                     "DfAzimuth",
00097                     "DfZenith",
00098                     "CfAzimuth",
00099                     "CfZenith",
00100                     "BfAzimuth",
00101                     "BfZenith",
00102                     "AfAzimuth",
00103                     "AfZenith",
00104                     "AnAzimuth",
00105                     "AnZenith",
00106                     "AaAzimuth",
00107                     "AaZenith",
00108                     "BaAzimuth",
00109                     "BaZenith",
00110                     "CaAzimuth",
00111                     "CaZenith",
00112                     "DaAzimuth",
00113                     "DaZenith"};
00114                 /* List of fields to copy. */
00115   int ifield;           /* Loop iterator. */
00116   int size_x;            /* Size of map along X axis. */
00117   int size_y;            /* Size of map along Y axis. */
00118   int32 tile_rank = 2;       /* HDF tile rank */
00119   int32 tile_dims[2] = {64,64};  /* Tile dimensions. */
00120   int32 comp_code = HDFE_COMP_DEFLATE; /* GZIP compression code. */
00121   int32 comp_parm[1] = {5};        /* GZIP compression level. */
00122   float32 fill_float32 = -9999.0;      /* Fill value for float32 fields. */
00123 
00124   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00125   /* Parse command-line arguments.                                      */
00126   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00127 
00128   if (process_args(argc, argv, &argr))
00129     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_BAD_ARGUMENT);
00130 
00131   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00132   /* Read projection / map information for target area.                 */
00133   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00134 
00135   status = MtkGCTPProjInfoRead(argr.proj_map_file, &target_proj_info);
00136   if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00137     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkGCTPProjInfoRead\n");
00138   }
00139 
00140   status = MtkGenericMapInfoRead(argr.proj_map_file, &target_map_info);
00141   if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00142     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkGenericMapInfoRead\n");
00143   }
00144 
00145   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00146   /* Get orbit path number of input file.                               */
00147   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00148 
00149   MtkFileToPath(argr.geom_file, &path);
00150 
00151   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00152   /* Setup SOM region containing the target map.                        */
00153   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00154 
00155   status = MtkSetRegionByGenericMapInfo(&target_map_info,
00156                     &target_proj_info,
00157                     path,
00158                     &region);
00159   if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00160     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkSetRegionByGenericMapInfo\n");
00161   }
00162 
00163   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00164   /* Create HDF-EOS file for result.                                    */
00165   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00166 
00167   if (target_map_info.origin_code == MTKe_ORIGIN_UL ||
00168       target_map_info.origin_code == MTKe_ORIGIN_LR) {
00169     dimlist = dimlist_ul_lr;
00170   } else {
00171     dimlist = dimlist_ur_ll;
00172   }
00173   
00174   edge[0] = target_map_info.size_line;
00175   edge[1] = target_map_info.size_sample;
00176 
00177   upleft[0] = target_map_info.min_x;
00178   upleft[1] = target_map_info.max_y;
00179   lowright[0] = target_map_info.max_x;
00180   lowright[1] = target_map_info.min_y;
00181     
00182   size_x = (int)floor((target_map_info.max_x - target_map_info.min_x) / 
00183               target_map_info.resolution_x + 0.5);
00184   size_y = (int)floor((target_map_info.max_y - target_map_info.min_y) / 
00185               target_map_info.resolution_y + 0.5);
00186 
00187   fid = GDopen(argr.output_filename,DFACC_CREATE);
00188   if (fid == FAIL) {
00189     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDopen\n");
00190   }
00191     
00192   hstatus = GDcreate(fid,OUTPUT_GRIDNAME,size_x, size_y, 
00193              upleft, lowright);
00194 
00195   gid = GDattach(fid, OUTPUT_GRIDNAME);
00196   if (gid == FAIL) {
00197     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDattach\n");
00198   }
00199   
00200   hstatus = GDdeforigin(gid,target_map_info.origin_code);
00201   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00202     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdeforigin\n");
00203   }
00204   
00205   hstatus = GDdefpixreg(gid,target_map_info.pix_reg_code);
00206   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00207     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdefpixreg\n");
00208   }
00209 
00210   hstatus = GDdefproj(gid,target_proj_info.proj_code,
00211               target_proj_info.zone_code, target_proj_info.sphere_code,
00212               target_proj_info.proj_param);
00213   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00214     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdefproj\n");
00215   }
00216 
00217   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00218   /* Calculate pixel lat/lon locations for target map.                  */
00219   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00220 
00221   status = MtkGCTPCreateLatLon(&target_map_info,
00222                    &target_proj_info,
00223                    &latitude,
00224                    &longitude);
00225   if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00226     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkGCTPCreateLatLon\n");
00227   }
00228 
00229 
00230   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00231   /* For each field to copy...                                          */
00232   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00233     
00234   for (ifield = 0 ; ifield < NUMBER_FIELD; ifield++) {
00235     MTKt_MapInfo    map_info = MTKT_MAPINFO_INIT;
00236                 /* Map information for this field. */
00237 
00238     printf("Processing %s...\n",fieldnames[ifield]);
00239  
00240   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00241   /* Read data for the target area.                                     */
00242   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00243 
00244     status = MtkReadData(argr.geom_file, GP_GMP_GRID_NAME, fieldnames[ifield],
00245              region, &geom_data_float64, &map_info);
00246     if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00247       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkReadData(geom)\n");
00248     }
00249 
00250   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00251   /* Convert float64 to float32.                                        */
00252   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00253 
00254     status = MtkDataBufferAllocate(geom_data_float64.nline, geom_data_float64.nsample,
00255                    MTKe_float, &geom_data);
00256     if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00257       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkDataBufferAllocate(geom_data)\n");
00258     }
00259     
00260     for (iline = 0; iline < geom_data.nline; iline++) {
00261       for (isample = 0; isample < geom_data.nsample; isample++) {
00262     geom_data.data.f[iline][isample] = geom_data_float64.data.d[iline][isample];
00263       }
00264     }
00265 
00266   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00267   /* Reproject data to the target map.                                  */ 
00268   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00269 
00270     status = MtkTransformCoordinates(map_info, 
00271                      latitude, 
00272                      longitude,
00273                      &line_coords,
00274                      &sample_coords);
00275     if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00276       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkTransformCoordinates\n");
00277     }
00278 
00279     status = MtkResampleNearestNeighbor(geom_data, 
00280                     line_coords, 
00281                     sample_coords, 
00282                     &resampled_geom_data);
00283     if (status != MTK_SUCCESS) {
00284       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with MtkResampleNearestNeighbor\n");
00285     }
00286 
00287   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00288   /* Write reprojected data to HDF-EOS file.                            */
00289   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00290       
00291     hstatus = GDdeffield(gid, fieldnames[ifield], dimlist, DFNT_FLOAT32, 0);
00292     if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00293       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdeffield()\n");
00294     }
00295 
00296     hstatus = GDsetfillvalue(gid, fieldnames[ifield], &fill_float32);
00297     if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00298       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDsetfillvalue()\n");
00299     }
00300     
00301     hstatus = GDsettilecomp(gid, fieldnames[ifield], tile_rank, 
00302                 tile_dims, comp_code, comp_parm);
00303     if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00304       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDsettilecomp()\n");
00305     }
00306 
00307     hstatus = GDwritefield(gid, fieldnames[ifield], NULL, NULL, edge, 
00308                resampled_geom_data.dataptr);
00309     if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00310       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDwritefield()\n");
00311     }
00312 
00313   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00314   /* Free memory.                                                       */
00315   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00316 
00317     MtkDataBufferFree(&line_coords);
00318     MtkDataBufferFree(&sample_coords);
00319     MtkDataBufferFree(&geom_data);
00320     MtkDataBufferFree(&geom_data_float64);
00321     MtkDataBufferFree(&resampled_geom_data);
00322     
00323   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00324   /* End loop for each field to copy.                                   */
00325   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00326 
00327   }
00328 
00329   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00330   /* Free memory.                                                       */
00331   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00332 
00333   MtkDataBufferFree(&latitude);
00334   MtkDataBufferFree(&longitude);
00335 
00336   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00337   /* Close HDF-EOS file.                                                */
00338   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
00339 
00340   hstatus = GDdetach(gid);
00341   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00342     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDdetach\n");
00343   }
00344   gid = FAIL;
00345   
00346   hstatus = GDclose(fid);
00347   if (hstatus == FAIL) {
00348     MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Trouble with GDclose\n");
00349   }
00350   fid = FAIL;
00351 
00352   printf("Wrote output to %s\n",argr.output_filename);
00353   printf("Completed normally.\n");
00354   return 0;
00355 
00356 ERROR_HANDLE:
00357   if (gid != FAIL) {
00358     hstatus = GDdetach(gid);
00359   }
00360   if (fid != FAIL) {
00361     hstatus = GDclose(fid);
00362   }
00363   
00364   MtkDataBufferFree(&geom_data);
00365   MtkDataBufferFree(&geom_data_float64);
00366   MtkDataBufferFree(&resampled_geom_data);
00367   MtkDataBufferFree(&latitude);
00368   MtkDataBufferFree(&longitude);
00369   MtkDataBufferFree(&line_coords);
00370   MtkDataBufferFree(&sample_coords);
00371 
00372   printf("Failed: status code = %d\n",status_code);
00373   
00374   return status_code;
00375 }
00376 
00377 void usage(char *func) {
00378   fprintf(stderr,
00379 "\nUsage: %s [--help] <projection/map info file>\n"
00380 "                     <GP_GMP file> <output filename>\n",
00381       func);
00382 
00383   fprintf(stderr,
00384 "\n"
00385 "Reproject MISR geometric parameters to the given map projection.\n"
00386 "Resampling is by nearest-neighbor.\n"
00387 "\n"
00388 "Result is written to an HDF-EOS file in the following fields:\n"
00389 "    SolarAzimuth                     Solar azimuth angle.\n"
00390 "    SolarZenith                      Solar zenith angle.\n"
00391 "    <cam>Azimuth                     View azimuth angle for this camera.\n"
00392 "    <cam>Zenith                      View zenith angle for this camera.\n"
00393 "\n"
00394 "All output fields have identical map projection and size.\n"
00395 "\n"
00396       );
00397 
00398   fprintf(stderr,
00399 "COMMAND-LINE OPTIONS\n"
00400 "\n"
00401 "--help\n"
00402 "     Returns this usage info.\n"
00403 "\n"
00404       );
00405 
00406   fprintf(stderr,
00407 "COMMAND-LINE ARGUMENTS\n"
00408 "\n"
00409 "<projection/map info file>\n"
00410 "    Text format file map projection for the output file.  Parameters are\n"
00411 "    specified as name = value pairs.   Parameter names are as follows:\n"
00412 "\n"
00413 "       proj_code is the GCTP projection code.\n"
00414 "       utm_zone is the UTM zone number for UTM projections only.\n"
00415 "       sphere_code is GCTP spheroid code.\n"
00416 "       proj_param(n) is the nth GCTP projection parameter.  (1 <= n <= 15)\n"
00417 "       min_corner_x is the minimum X coordinate at the edge of the map.\n"
00418 "       min_corner_y is the minimum Y coordinate at the edge of the map.\n"
00419 "       resolution_x is the size of a pixel along the X-axis.\n"
00420 "       resolution_y is the size of a pixel along the Y-axis.\n"
00421 "       number_pixel_x is the size of the map in pixels, along the X-axis.\n"
00422 "       number_pixel_y is the size of the map in pixels, along the Y-axis.\n"
00423 "       origin_code defines the corner of the map at which pixel 0,0 is located.\n"
00424 "       pix_reg_code defines whether a pixel value is related to the corner or\n"
00425 "         center of the corresponding area of that pixel on the map.  If the\n"
00426 "         corner is used, then it is always the corner corresponding to the\n"
00427 "         corner of the origin.\n"
00428 "\n"
00429 "       Possible values for origin_code are:\n"
00430 "         UL - Upper Left (min X, max Y)\n"
00431 "         UR - Upper Right (max X, max Y)\n"
00432 "         LL - Lower Left (min X, min Y)\n"
00433 "         LR - Lower Right (max X, min Y)\n"
00434 "\n"
00435 "       Possible values are:\n"
00436 "         CENTER - Center\n"
00437 "         CORNER - Corner\n"
00438 "\n"
00439 "       Unrecognized parameter names are ignored.\n"
00440 "       Lines starting with a '#' character are ignored.\n"
00441 "       Anything after the name = value pair on a line is ignored.\n"
00442 "\n"
00443 "       Example projection/map info file:\n"
00444 "       # Albers equal-area conic projection parameters\n"
00445 "       proj_code = 3    # Albers equal-area conic\n"
00446 "       sphere_code = 8  # GRS80\n"
00447 "       proj_param(3) = 29030000.0  # Latitude of the first standard parallel\n"
00448 "       proj_param(4) = 45030000.0  # Latitude of the second standard parallel\n"
00449 "       proj_param(5) = -96000000.0 # Longitude of the central meridian\n"
00450 "       proj_param(6) = 23000000.0  # Latitude of the projection origin\n"
00451 "       # Map information\n"
00452 "       min_corner_x = 1930612.449614\n"
00453 "       min_corner_y = 2493633.488881\n"
00454 "       resolution_x = 250.0\n"
00455 "       resolution_y = 250.0\n"
00456 "       number_pixel_x = 1311\n"
00457 "       number_pixel_y = 2078\n"
00458 "       origin_code = UL        # Min x, Max y; Line=Y, Sample=X\n"
00459 "       pix_reg_code = CENTER\n"
00460 "\n"
00461 "\n"
00462 "<GP_GMP file>\n"
00463 "    MISR Geometric parameters (GP_GMP).\n"
00464 "\n"
00465 "<output filename>\n"
00466 "    Filename for output file.\n"
00467 "\n"
00468 "Example:\n"
00469 "\n"
00470 "     MtkResampleGeom proj_map_info.txt \\\n"
00471 "         MISR_AM1_GP_GMP_P011_O013842_F03_0013.hdf \\\n"
00472 "         GEOM_O013824_maine.hdf\n"
00473 "\n"
00474       );
00475 }
00476 
00477 int process_args(int argc, char *argv[], argr_type *argr) {
00478 
00479   MTKt_status status_code = MTK_FAILURE;
00480   extern char *optarg;
00481   extern int optind;
00482   int ch;
00483 
00484   /* options descriptor */
00485   static struct option longopts[] = {
00486     { "help", no_argument,       0, 'h' },
00487     { 0,      0,                 0,  0 }
00488   };
00489 
00490   while ((ch = getopt_long(argc, argv, "h", longopts, NULL)) != -1) {
00491 
00492     switch(ch) {
00493     case 'h':
00494       MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_FAILURE);
00495       break;
00496     default:
00497       MTK_ERR_MSG_JUMP("Invalid arguments");
00498     }
00499   }
00500 
00501   if (argc-optind != 3) MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00502 
00503   argr->proj_map_file = argv[optind++];
00504   argr->geom_file = argv[optind++];
00505   argr->output_filename = argv[optind++];
00506 
00507   return MTK_SUCCESS;
00508  ERROR_HANDLE:
00509   usage(argv[0]);
00510   return status_code;
00511 }
